task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and goal, align the circular end-effector, make gentle contact, then push the block along the table toward the goal region and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR5-style manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a tabletop into a marked goal region. The contact-sheet shows the arm approaching from above, establishing contact near the block’s stem, and executing a planar push while maintaining alignment. The design emphasizes reliable perception, controlled contact establishment, and a straight-line push. Observation and control occur at 10 Hz, but timing bins rely on library-discrete timeouts. Recovery includes re-scanning if the block is not visible and re-approach if contact is lost.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T-shaped block and a goal outline
Camera feed available for object visibility
Robot reachable workspace covers block and goal
End-effector pose control enabled in the plane
stepwise_plan: Check visibility or scan for the T-shaped block
Move above the block with safe clearance
Yaw-align the tool with intended push direction
Lower until contact and verify contact
Align toward goal and execute a straight push
success_criteria: Block’s centroid intersects the goal region
failure_and_recovery: If block not detected, raster scan up to 3 attempts
If contact not detected, re-approach and lower again
If push deviates, re-align and perform another push segment
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the block is pushed into the goal region and the robot has retreated to a safe standoff.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T-shaped block is visible before proceeding.
Raster scan to localize the T-shaped block if not immediately visible.
Move to a pre-contact pose above the block with safe clearance.
Align the tool yaw with the push direction along the table x-axis.
Lower vertically until contact is detected to start a controlled push.
Verify that contact has been established before pushing.
Align the pushing direction toward the goal region with tight tolerance.
Execute a straight push along +x toward the goal.
Back off to a safe standoff after the push.

failure_modes: Object not visible due to occlusion or lighting
Contact not detected leading to slip
Push direction misaligned causing off-target motion
Timeouts during motion due to unexpected obstruction
recovery_strategy: Re-scan up to 3 attempts when visibility fails
Re-approach and re-lower if contact check fails
Re-align using ApproachAndAlign then reissue Push
Retreat and retry sequence on timeout
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and a blue goal outline, whereas instruction mentions gray block and green target; plan grounded on frames
End-effector appears circular and blue as in instruction
10 Hz frequencies are informational and do not map to control timeouts constrained by library bins

expected_success_criteria: Final block pose intersects the goal outline
No loss of contact during the main push segment
